prophets.title: Day 1 Prophet Story 10
prophets.story: His story of tears, patience, and unwavering trust remains a powerful lesson: No matter how deep our grief, Allah’s mercy and guidance are always near for those who turn to Him.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 1
prophets.story: Prophet Yusuf (AS) had a powerful dream where he saw eleven stars, the sun, and the moon bowing to him. This dream symbolized his future rise in power and the respect he would gain, but also sparked envy among his brothers.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 2
prophets.story: His brothers, driven by jealousy, conspired to get rid of him. They threw Yusuf (AS) into a well, leaving him to face hardship and uncertainty, yet he remained patient and trusting in Allah’s plan.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 3
prophets.story: Rescued by a caravan, Yusuf (AS) was sold into slavery in Egypt. Despite the hardship, he maintained his faith, and Allah’s guidance helped him interpret dreams and rise to a position of power in Egypt.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 4
prophets.story: Years later, Yusuf (AS) interpreted Pharaoh’s dream about an upcoming famine, advising him to prepare. His wisdom and integrity ultimately led to his appointment as a trusted advisor.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 5
prophets.story: During the famine, Yusuf’s brothers came to Egypt seeking food. He recognized them, forgave them, and revealed his identity, exemplifying patience, forgiveness, and Allah’s divine plan.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 6
prophets.story: His rise from betrayal and hardship to a position of power shows how patience and trust in Allah can transform trials into triumphs.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 7
prophets.story: Yusuf’s story teaches us that dreams can be a sign from Allah, guiding us through difficulties and toward righteous success if we trust in His wisdom.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 8
prophets.story: His patience and reliance on Allah turned a personal dream into a story that changed history, inspiring countless generations with hope and faith.

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 9

prophets.title: The Dream That Changed History (Yusuf AS) Part 10
prophets.story: Prophet Yusuf’s (AS) dream and patience show that divine guidance and trust in Allah lead to a legacy that influences the course of history.

sahabah.story: Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA), known for his strength and leadership, was initially hostile to Islam. One night, he heard the recitation of the Quran from a Muslim and was deeply moved by its beauty and truth.

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 2
sahabah.story: The powerful recitation touched his heart profoundly, igniting a spark of faith and curiosity that led him to question his previous hostility toward Islam.

sahabah.story: He sought out the Prophet (SAW) and, after hearing the message directly, accepted Islam wholeheartedly. This moment marked a turning point in his life and the history of Islam.

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 5

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 6
sahabah.story: He dedicated his life to justice, Quranic principles, and supporting the Prophet (SAW) in establishing the Islamic state.

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 7
sahabah.story: His story teaches us that a sincere encounter with the Quran can lead to profound change, even for the strongest and most determined.

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 8
sahabah.story: His leadership and justice as Caliph were rooted in his deep love for Allah and His Book, inspiring generations of Muslims.

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 9

sahabah.title: The Night When Umar (RA) Heard the Quran (Umar ibn al-Khattab RA) Part 10

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 1
prophets.story: Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was known for his unwavering honesty from a young age, earning him the nickname Al-Amin (The Trustworthy). Even before revelation, he was trusted by all in Mecca for his truthfulness.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 2
prophets.story: When he received revelation, he conveyed Allah’s message honestly, regardless of the opposition. His courage to speak the truth against idol worship and corruption made him stand alone in his unwavering commitment.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 3
prophets.story: Despite facing hostility, he continued to call for justice, compassion, and monotheism. His words challenged the powerful and exposed falsehood, earning him enemies but retaining his integrity.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 4
prophets.story: He openly condemned injustice, even when it meant risking his life. His unwavering stance made him the ultimate trustworthy messenger, speaking truth to power in the face of danger.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 5

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 6

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Spoke the Truth Alone (Muhammad ﷺ) Part 7

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 1
prophets.story: Prophet Nuh (AS) was sent to a corrupt and heedless nation. Despite their rejection and mockery, he tirelessly called them to worship Allah alone, pleading with sincere heart and tears in his eyes. For many years, he preached day and night, urging them to abandon idol worship and turn to Allah for salvation.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 2
prophets.story: Nuh (AS) endured mockery for years, but he never wavered. His tears flowed as he begged Allah to guide his people, saying, ‘My Lord, do not leave any of the disbelievers on earth.’ His love was boundless, and his supplication heartfelt.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 3
prophets.story: Despite his sincere prayers, the people continued their sins. Watching their destruction unfold, Nuh (AS) wept bitterly, praying desperately for their salvation and mercy from Allah. His tears reflected his deep love and concern for their guidance, knowing they were heading towards inevitable punishment.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 4
prophets.story: Allah commanded Nuh (AS) to build the Ark. As he toiled with tears streaming down his face, he felt the weight of heartbreak for his people, yet he trusted Allah’s promise of rescue for the believers. His patience and obedience were unwavering, even as he faced rejection and hardship.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 5
prophets.story: When the floodwaters rose, Nuh (AS) watched helplessly, tears falling as he saw the destruction of the wicked. Only the believers and his family were saved, a mercy from Allah amid divine punishment. His heart ached for those who were drowned, yet he remained hopeful and patient.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 6
prophets.story: After the flood receded, Nuh (AS) looked out with hope, trusting in Allah’s mercy. He sent out a dove, and when it returned empty, he knew Allah’s mercy was near, and a new beginning was possible for those who turned back to Him.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 7
prophets.story: His tears of grief turned into tears of gratitude as he saw signs of Allah’s mercy, and he made dua for the future generations. He prayed that they would learn from their past mistakes, and turn to Allah before it was too late.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 8
prophets.story: Nuh (AS) remained patient and hopeful, knowing that Allah’s mercy surpasses all. His tears and prayers teach us that sincere supplication can bring relief even in the darkest moments, and that Allah’s mercy is always near.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 9
prophets.story: His story reminds us that prophets are human too—capable of tears, love, and deep sorrow. But their trust in Allah’s mercy is what sustains them through hardship, and their prayers can move mountains.

prophets.title: The Prophet Who Wept for His People (Nuh AS) Part 10
prophets.story: Nuh’s (AS) tears, prayers, and unwavering love for his people demonstrate that true prophets are those who weep for their community and trust that Allah’s mercy will ultimately prevail. His story continues to inspire us to pray with sincerity and patience.

sahabah.story: Talhah ibn Ubayy (RA) was known for his bravery, sacrifice, and unwavering support for Islam. From the moment he embraced Islam, he dedicated his life to serving Allah and His Messenger, facing hardships with patience and humility.

sahabah.title: The Sahabi Who Was Promised Jannah While Alive (Talhah RA) Part 2
sahabah.story: The Prophet (SAW) saw Talhah (RA) in a dream, saying, ‘Talhah is in Jannah,’ a promise he carried with gratitude and sincerity. This promise reflected his steadfastness in supporting Islam through thick and thin.

sahabah.title: The Sahabi Who Was Promised Jannah While Alive (Talhah RA) Part 3
sahabah.story: During the Battle of Uhud, Talhah (RA) fought valiantly, protecting the Prophet (SAW) and the believers. Despite multiple wounds, he remained courageous, trusting Allah’s promise of eternal reward.

sahabah.title: The Sahabi Who Was Promised Jannah While Alive (Talhah RA) Part 4
sahabah.story: He donated his wealth to support Islam, even giving away all his possessions, trusting Allah’s promise of Jannah and eternal happiness. His sacrifice was driven by pure faith and love for Allah.

sahabah.title: The Sahabi Who Was Promised Jannah While Alive (Talhah RA) Part 5
sahabah.story: Talhah (RA) was known for his humility and devotion. Despite his high status among the companions, he remained simple and sincere, focusing on pleasing Allah alone.
